circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Doreen Marfeo was reported missing by her husband who says his wife was not home when he arrived at 4:00PM on 3/29/1990.

notes.description: Person(s) related to Marfeo by blood in Rhode Island, Massachusetts, or Connecticut are asked to contact Detective Lieutenant Christopher Correia at the Johnston Police Department (401-231-4210).

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Robert (also missing with his brother Stephen) left a note at their home stating they were going fishing at Fort Wethrill State Park and would return by 4pm. As the evening progress the father started to get worried and went to their fishing location. Their car was parked and locked and one of their fishing poles and bait container lying on the rocks. They have not been seen since.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Unknown but one brother typically wore a red vest.

vehicles.comment: Vehicle was parked near fishing location.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Reported missing from Roger Williams College, believed to have jumped from Mt Hope Bridge.  September of 1997 a boot and shinbone were located and confirmed to belong to Bryan Nisenfeld.
Went overboard from fishing vessel while at sea approximately one mile northeast of Galilee, Narragansett, Rhode Island

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Lester was last seen in the area of Arnold's Neck Drive/Staples Avenue Warwick, RI.  Days later, Lester's vehicle and dog were found abandoned at different ends of the city.

physicalDescription.headHairDescription: Short or balding.  Known to wear wigs.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Wojtek was last seen running naked on Gallilee Escape Road adjacent to the Gallilee Bird Sanctuary. He left his phone, keys, money, and clothes at the home where he was staying. The temperature outside that day was around 30 degrees.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Wojteck was not wearing any clothing at the time of his disappearance.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Fudali has a tattoo of a black eagle with a yellow and green background under his left rib cage.
He has a gap between his upper front teeth.

images.caption: Tattoo below Fudali's left rib cage.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Katrina McVeigh was last seen getting into a car near Front and Lincoln Street. Family members have never heard from her again.

Last seen on November 4th, 1971 at Archie's Tavern in Pawtucket, RI where she received a phone call from a male after which she immediately left. Her car was recovered by her husband three days later at the Holiday Inn in South Attleboro, MA.

images.caption: Picture from Lincoln PD Missing Person Announcement

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: William "Hokey" Hokanson Sr went out on a fishing expedition with his son William "Billy" Hokanson Jr (MP # 25526) on their vessel the "Sol-e-Mar" and left out of Fairhaven, MA. On March 25th, 1990 the United States Coast Guard received a 4 second distress call from Billy Hokanson, and on March 30th, 1990 the Coast Guard was notified that the "Sol-e-Mar" was two days overdue. After three days the Coast Guard suspended its search. However, the "Sol-e-Mar" was found later in April of 1990 by a crew of volunteer on the "R/V Marlin" vessel. Despite this search, no bodies were ever recovered. William Hokanson Sr and Jr and both still missing at sea.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Harley Davidson wings on left arm

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Francisco enlisted in the Massachusetts Army National Guard.  His orders directed him to travel to Fort Dix, New Jersey on August 8, 1976.  He went to the AMTRAK train station in Providence, RI accompanied by friends and family.  He boarded the train with other recruits and his recruiter but never arrived in Fort Dix, New Jersey.  He has not been seen or heard from since.

Frank had entered a sailboat race at the Edgewood Yacht Club with a friend. After the race, he stopped at Henry’s convenience store in Cranston, Rhode Island and visited with another friend who was working. Frank told him that might see him the next day. This was the last confirmed sighting of Frank.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description:
White t-shirt
Brown plaid slacks (His name was printed inside his trouser pockets)
Loafer shoes

vehicles.comment: No known vehicles associated at this time.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Full lips, olive complexion, large pock mark on lower right jaw, Chicken pox marks on left side of face and forehead, scar on right side of head, and appendix scar

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Crewmember of the Fishing Vessel BARBARA ANN in the Atlantic Canyons, approximately 67NM east of Cape May, NJ in position N39-38.5 W070-37.00

notes.description: Contact Detective Bureau, RISP OCA 11RIX1-992-OF, Detective OCA D95-678

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: William "Hokey" Hokanson Sr ( MP # 25525) went out on a fishing expedition with his son William "Billy" Hokanson Jr on their vessel the "Sol-e-Mar" and left out of Fairhaven, MA. On March 25th, 1990 the United States Coast Guard received a 4 second distress call from Billy Hokanson, and on March 30th, 1990 the Coast Guard was notified that the "Sol-e-Mar" was two days overdue. After three days the Coast Guard suspended its search. However, the "Sol-e-Mar" was found later in April of 1990 by a crew of volunteer on the "R/V Marlin" vessel. Despite this search, no bodies were ever recovered. William Hokanson Sr and Jr and both still missing at sea.

Subject convicted of Murder II 11/10/1993, weapon used was a knife.  While out on bail, prior to sentencing, vehicle located at top of Newport Bridge, Newport, RI, investigation began trying to determine if Emery and his wife jumped or staged scene to flee.  A skull located approximately one year later, confirmed to be Adam Emery's wife.  Adam Emery never located.
October 3, 1977, Ronald Leone and Rudy Baronet (MP 42892) left the Leone family residence in Johnston, Rhode Island, apparently to visit a friend. Neither has ever been seen or heard from since.
Crewmember of the fishing vessel MISTRESS. Reportedly went down with the ship approximately 3nm off of Block Island, NY.
Probable homicide victim. Organized crime related.  Companion case: Gregory Georgantis (MP 33332).

A 19-foot outboard motorboat was found swamped and adrift about 15 miles southeast of Block Island.  USCG found no sign of Peter R. Carocci or his friend Michael J. Sweet (MP40224).  Both have been missing since failing to return on Saturday, 8/15/87 from a 4 hour fishing trip.
Suspected suicide from the top of The Jamestown Bridge.

Missing was aboard a Piper Navajo airplane bearing tail#  N41173  on its way to East Hampton Airport. The airplane went down in the Atlantic Ocean. 3 of the 4 passengers bodies where recovered. 

Partial remains found were positively identified as William. Case will remain open in NamUs pending additional remains recovered.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Multi colored Polo shirt and brown Shorts
Rolex watch with a white face

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Observed jumping from Newport Bridge
Patrick was last visit seen on Jan. 4, 2023. Calls and texts to his phone were not answered. An attempt in Dec. 2023 to call the phone said it was not in service.

physicalDescription.eyeDescription: No distance glasses, occasional for reading

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Unknown. Frank was last seen at approximately 9:00am at his residence in the vicinity of the 100 block of Oak St. in Westerly, RI. His vehicle was later located in his driveway and all belongings were also located.

Left Parents House by foot to meet at sister house. One street away.  When his sister whom was driving home arrived at her house he was not awaiting her.

It was reported to police 10 days later on his sisters Birthday 12/12/1986

Robert Rocchio left his home sometime after 1 p.m. Saturday and hasn't returned. He was last seen walking in the area of Atwood Avenue.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Michael's vehicle was found unattended in the parking area of the Great Swamp Management Area (277 Great Neck Rd. in South Kingstown) on June 15th 2019. He was last seen by his family on June 13th 2019.

notes.description: Michael loves animals and nature, hiking, geo-caching, video games and he loves all things Pokémon. He savors solitude and is tech-savvy. He walks stiffly due to back issues, like his upper body is stiff.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Last seen by family in Providence, R.I.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Sometimes used glasses but not always.  Clothing description is unknown.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Had green outline of some cherries on the back of one her left shoulder. Cherries were not colored in. Also has an unknown tattoo on one of her left ankle.
